item.title: Screening distances
item.description: Guidelines for evaluating the noise impact of a maintenance facility near a school may specify certain screening distances to select schools, but they are ‘NOT a substitute for case- and site-specific evaluation of potential risks and hazards’. These distances may not be a good predictor of an environmental hazard. Federal Transportation Administration (FTA) guidelines mention that ‘a maintenance facility near a school’ (p. 33) is one location recommended for a ‘Detailed Noise Analysis’ The ‘screening distance for noise assessments’ at a school is 1,000 feet for unobstructed distances 650 feet for obstructed distances (‘with intervening buildings’) According to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) school siting guidelines

item.title: Monitoring Locations
item.description: GoTriangle estimated noise levels for areas near the railyard operations maintenance facility site based on long term noise monitoring sites nowhere near the ROMF site, west of I-40. Closest long-term noise monitoring sites closest to Creekside and west of I-40 were: 214 Celeste Circle, Chapel Hill (LT-4) 4315 Randall Road, Durham (LT-5) Annotated map of noise monitoring sites from noise report
